fields.headline: Live music booking now
fields.bodyText: Formerly brooding presence behind alt-country miserablists (Smog), Bill Callahan brings new album Apocalypse to our shores (5-10 May, begins The Academy, Dublin) … Graham Coxon, Cornershop and Katy B pull on their wellies for Lounge On The Farm (Merton Farm, Kent, 8-10 Jul) … Depeche Mode's Martin L Gore, Richie Hawtin and Moby are new additions to the Short Circuit Present Mute bill (13-14 May, Roundhouse, NW1) … Squarepusher, Fuck Buttons and LFO shake the tin for victims of the tsunami at ATP's Made In Japan (21 Apr, HMV Forum, NW5) … Razorlight bring bare chests and big-brimmed hats to headline Get Loaded In The Park (12 Jun, Clapham Common, SW4) … British Sea Power rock out and Martin Scorsese curates the outdoor cinema at Port Eliot Festival (21-24 Jul, St Germans, Cornwall) … Salford's answer to the Camden Crawl, Sounds From The Other City (1 May, Chapel St) lines up Willy Mason and Those Dancing Days, plus the likes of Andrew WK playing down a transatlantic phone line for one punter.
